title: El Topo (The Mole)
content:
I'd heard some good things about this movie, and I got around to watching it today. I have no idea what it's about, but it's intense. If you like David Lynch movies, see this! If you hate David Lynch movies, don't see this!

I'm still processing the movie in my head and don't really know what to say about it except "wow."

El Topo (The Mole) - 1970 - In Spanish with English Subtitles

I guess I'll try to describe the film a little bit - here are a couple of the more memorable scenes in the movie: The man with no arms with a man with no legs tied onto his back ... together, they function as one person with arms and legs. The priest who plays Russian Roulette during church - if you don't die, it's "a miracle."

And lastly, on a more commercial note, John Lennon said that this was his favorite film.

Anyone else here seen it? What did you think?

title: Re: El Topo (The Mole)
content:
I've never even heard of it, but it sounds interesting, especially that two-in-one person.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."
